intro: Quamoclit angulata, commonly known as the angular leaf or false dandelion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, angular leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Quamoclit angulata is native to parts of North America and is often found in moist, disturbed soils. It is a perennial herb that can grow up to 30 centimeters tall.
